snippet: Mitt Romney and Newt Gingrich are just the latest Republicans to stop using songs at their rallies after songwriters complained that the campaigns had played the pieces without permission.
abstract: Mitt Romney and Newt Gingrich are asked to stop using songs at their rallies after songwriters complain that the campaigns had played the pieces without permission; are just the latest Republican candidates struggling to find an iconic song by an artist who is supportive of their politics.
lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney and Newt Gingrich are just the latest Republicans to stop using songs at their rallies after songwriters complained that the campaigns had played the pieces without permission.

headline.seo: Romney and Gingrich Pull Songs After Complaints
headline.main: G.O.P. Candidates Are Told, Don’t Use the Verses, It’s Not Your Song
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Candidates Are Told, Don’t Use the Verses, It’s Not Your Song
